## Ongoing work

[Beelines project](https://urbangreennewcastle.org/our-work/beelines-north-east/). 45 sites across various parks. 

--> Pollinator friendly environment. For example, via:

--

* Delaying mowing

--

* Flower rich bedding planted

--

## Knowledge gap

* Is this noticed?

--

* Is this well-received?

--

* How do different uses of parks relate to attitudes toward pollinators and these interventions?

--

* Emotions towards nature / pollinators.

```{r, out.width = "400px", echo=FALSE, fig.align='center'}
knitr::include_graphics("https://media.giphy.com/media/3S13KRy5AzPScqliki/giphy.gif") 
```

---
## Positive emotions

* Are tied to nature connectedness, willingness to learn about nature, and pro-environmental behaviours `r Citep(bib, "Hoyle2017","Williamson2022a")`. 

--

* Especially, 'awe' `r Citep(bib, "Ng2023")`.

--

* If we can establish associations between attitudes and emotions, then perhaps these can be harnessed in messaging and future interventions.

## Content

* Co-designed with Urban Green Newcastle

--

* knowledge of the management changes in their local park (i.e. mowing changes and/or floral enhancements)

--

* sociodemographics

--

* use of parks

--

* attitudes towards pollinators `r Citep(bib, "Knapp2021")`

--

* positive emotions, such as awe `r Citep(bib, "Yaden2019")`

---
## Outcomes

* Platform for future (funded) work: intervention, measuring well-being / health.

--

* Strengthening collaboration with Urban Green.
